entry.title: NFT Sales Surge 31% This Week as Bitcoin NFTs Secure Second Place in Blockchain Sales
entry.summary:
Non-fungible token (NFT) sales witnessed a minor rise last week, registering a humble increase of around 1.46% compared to the preceding week. The cumulative value of NFT sales amounted to $149.31 million from April 29 to May 6, 2023. Nevertheless, the most recent week exceeded anticipations, as sales skyrocketed by 31.22%. Throughout the seven-day interval, NFT sales attained $208.17 million. The substantial rise in this week‚Äôs NFT sales can be credited to the appearance of NFTs originating from the Bitcoin blockchain.
Bitcoin-Based NFT Sales Gain Significant Momentum

Bitcoin Makes Progress in Clearing Backlog, but Lightning Network Capacity and Channels Dropped Amid Congestion
entry.summary:
In the past week, the Bitcoin network has made progress in resolving its congestion issues. On May 7, 2023, the number of unconfirmed transactions reached an all-time high of over 500,000 transfers, causing a major backlog. However, as of today, that number has been reduced to 263,406. Currently, 184 blocks need to be cleared to process the majority of transactions that are still stuck in the network‚Äôs mempool.
Congestion Woes Ease on Bitcoin Network
The long queue of transactions is finally starting to subside as bitcoin miners have started catching up with some of the backlog. As we reported three days ago, Bitcoin.com News noted the beginning of the congestion-clearing process, with unconfirmed transactions dropping from over 500,000 on May 7 to just above 300,000 on Thursday, May ‚Ä¶

entry.title: To Reach Women, Bitcoiners Should Change Their Approach
entry.summary:
This is an opinion editorial by Tali Lindberg, co-founder of Free Market Kids, a company focused on financial literacy and Bitcoin education. Author‚Äôs note: This is a politically-incorrect article because I‚Äôm about to make gross generalizations about men and women. If you are easily offended, you probably shouldn‚Äôt read on. When I first entered the Bitcoin space, I met a woman who asked me if I was interested in starting a woman‚Äôs Bitcoin meetup. ‚ÄúI wish there was one,‚Äù she said. At the time, I was a bit offended by the idea. ‚ÄúBitcoin is already a small space, why would we want to separate men and women?‚Äù I wondered. Since then, I‚Äôve had a change of heart.
Source: Author
Having participated in many Bitcoin events in different cities and sta‚Ä¶

entry.title: ‚ÄòThe Future of Digital Payments Lies in Web3 Payment Services‚Äô Says Robert Miller of Fuse
entry.summary:
Despite not being mainstream payment solutions yet, cryptocurrency-based payments (also known as Web3 payments) already bring benefits such as lower transaction fees, Robert Miller, the vice president of growth at Fuse, a layer 1, EVM-compatible blockchain for launching dapps, has asserted. For merchants, Web3 payments come with the added benefit of what Miller called protection from ‚Äúfraudulent chargebacks.‚Äù
Crypto Payments Trump Traditional Payment Methods
To back his assertions, Miller claimed many of the merchants that are presently experimenting with or encouraging their customers to use Web3 payments are doing so because they are seeking a better deal than what they are getting from traditional payment providers.
Miller, however, conceded that Web3 payments are still at their i‚Ä¶

entry.title: IRS, Chainalysis Helping Ukraine Track Russians Using Crypto to Evade Sanctions
entry.summary:
The U.S. Internal Revenue Service (IRS) said it‚Äôs working closely with Ukraine to help it trace crypto transactions of Russian sanctions evaders. The agency is providing the Ukrainians access to a Chainalysis tool as well as specialized training to Ukrainian law enforcement.
IRS Offers Ukraine Tools From Chainalysis to Trace Russian Blockchain Transactions
The criminal investigation division of the United States Internal Revenue Service announced it‚Äôs stepping up collaboration with counterparts abroad as part of efforts to identify persons and entities evading Western sanctions.
The agency revealed it‚Äôs working with blockchain forensics firm Chainalysis and Ukrainian investigators to track Russians who might be using cryptocurrencies to conceal their assets amid financial restriction‚Ä¶

entry.title: Russian Companies ‚ÄòActively‚Äô Using Crypto, Russia to Adopt 4 Relevant Laws, Official Says
entry.summary:
Russian lawmakers intend to soon approve four bills designed to regulate various aspects of cryptocurrencies, a high-ranking member of the Russian parliament announced. Meanwhile, Russian companies are already using digital assets in cross-border settlements, the official noted.
Russian Legislature to Vote on Crypto Laws by End of July
The State Duma, the lower house of the Russian parliament, plans to adopt four crypto-related laws during its spring session which ends on July 30, according to Anatoly Aksakov, chairman of the parliamentary Financial Market Committee.
The bills are tailored to regulate cryptocurrency mining, cross-border crypto payments, taxation of digital assets, and liability for their illegal use, the lawmaker detailed, quoted by the Interfax news agency. He empha‚Ä¶

entry.title: Gallup Poll: Americans‚Äô Preference for Real Estate, Crypto Plunges ‚Äî Fondness for Gold Skyrockets
entry.summary:
A recent Gallup Poll reveals a significant decline in the percentage of Americans favoring real estate as their preferred long-term investment, despite its continued popularity. Conversely, the Gallup survey indicates that the perception of long-term investments in gold has experienced an almost twofold increase compared to the previous year‚Äôs poll on the same topic.
Gallup Poll Reveals Preference for Real Estate and Crypto Slides, While Bias Toward Gold Nearly Doubles
Gallup, Inc., the analytics and advisory company headquartered in Washington, D.C., recently unveiled its latest Gallup Poll on long-term investments on May 11, 2023. With a history dating back to 1935, Gallup has been conducting public opinion polls worldwide.
The poll, conducted from April 3 to April 25, 2023, delve‚Ä¶

South Africa Denies It Supplied Ammunition to Russia
The exchange rate of the South African currency versus the greenback fell to a new all-time low of 19.51 units of the rand for every dollar on May 12. The rand‚Äôs plunge came a day after the African country was accused of secretly supplying ammunition to Russia by a United States ambassador.

entry.title: 10 Southeast Asian Nations Challenge Dollar Dominance With Push for Local Currencies
entry.summary:
The leaders of 10 Southeast Asian nations, members of the Association of Southeast Asian Nations (ASEAN), have agreed to ‚Äúencourage the use of local currencies for economic and financial transactions.‚Äù The group comprises Brunei, Cambodia, Indonesia, Laos, Malaysia, Myanmar, Philippines, Singapore, Thailand, and Vietnam. This move will help them reduce their reliance on the U.S. dollar.
Southeast Asian Countries‚Äô De-Dollarization Efforts
The leaders of the Association of Southeast Asian Nations (ASEAN) gathered in Labuan Bajo, Indonesia, for the 42nd ASEAN Summit on May 10-11 under the chairmanship of the Republic of Indonesia. ASEAN members comprise Brunei, Cambodia, Indonesia, Laos, Malaysia, Myanmar, Philippines, Singapore, Thailand, and Vietnam. The summit was chaired by H.E. Joko ‚Ä¶

entry.title: US Government Faces ‚ÄòSignificant Risk‚Äô of Default in June, Congressional Budget Office Warns
entry.summary:
The Congressional Budget Office (CBO) has stressed that ‚Äúthere is a significant risk that the Treasury will run out of funds at some point in the first two weeks of June‚Äù if the debt ceiling is not raised or suspended. The CBO‚Äôs projection is in line with the estimate by the Treasury Department that a U.S. default could occur on June 1.
CBO Sees ‚ÄòSignificant Risk‚Äô of the U.S. Defaulting in June
The Congressional Budget Office (CBO) released an update to the Budget Outlook for 2023 to 2033 Friday. The report updates CBO‚Äôs budget projections released in February.

entry.title: Ethereum Patch Set to Fix Transaction Finality Challenges After Second Bout Disrupts Network
entry.summary:
On Friday, Ethereum‚Äôs Beacon chain encountered yet another bout of transaction finality challenges, reminiscent of the glitch experienced on May 11, 2023. For over an hour, the blockchain stopped the process of finalizing blocks. However, Superphiz, an Ethereum developer, emphasized that despite this setback, ‚ÄúNo transactions were halted‚Äù and the incident had ‚Äúzero impact on chain activity.‚Äù
Developers Insist Ethereum‚Äôs Transaction Finality Glitch Is Now Patched
In a span of two consecutive days, the Ethereum blockchain encountered transaction finality challenges, commencing on May 11, 2023, and recurring on May 12. Although the initial incident lasted a mere 25 minutes, the glitch on Friday persisted for over an hour. The exact cause of these halts remains uncertain, although speculat‚Ä¶

entry.title: Quadriga CX Customers to Finally Receive Payout: Creditors to Get 13% per Dollar
entry.summary:
EY, the global accounting and professional services organization, released a long-awaited update on Friday for the creditors of Quadriga CX. The Canadian cryptocurrency exchange, which had sought bankruptcy protection in 2019 with liabilities of C$215.7 million and assets totaling around C$28 million, had left its creditors in a state of uncertainty. In the latest notice from EY, it was revealed that Quadriga creditors will receive a payout equivalent to 13.094156% of the total value of their claims.
EY‚Äôs Update Offers Redemption for Quadriga CX Creditors With Haircut Compensation Plan
After enduring a protracted bankruptcy process that commenced in 2019, Quadriga CX‚Äòs customers and creditors can finally breathe a sigh of relief as they are set to receive a payout from the estate. Once‚Ä¶

entry.title: Biggest Movers: SOL up 5%, as LINK Breaks Key Resistance Level on Saturday
entry.summary:
Solana rose by as much as 5% in today‚Äôs session, as cryptocurrencies began to recover from Friday‚Äôs red wave. The global market cap was up by nearly 2% at the time of writing. Chainlink also rose, moving back above a key resistance level.
Solana (SOL)
Solana (SOL) moved back above the $20.00 mark to start the weekend, as the token rose by as much as 5% today.
Following a low of $19.81 on Friday, SOL/USD jumped to an intraday peak at $21.25 on Saturday.
The rebound came as solana collided with an interim floor at $19.90, which has acted as the last line of defense following breakout below $20.00.
Looking at the chart, there was a similar rebound at the same point on April 10, which then led SOL to going on a six-day win streak.
Saturday‚Äôs rally also came as the relative strength index (RSI) jumped beyond a ceiling at the 45.00 mark.
At the time of writing this, the index is now tracking at 46.49, with the next visible point of resistance at 50.00.
Chainlink (LINK)
Chainlink (LINK) also moved higher in today‚Äôs session, with price breaking out of a key price point.
LINK/USD raced to a high of $6.63 to start the weekend, hours after falling to a low of $6.37.
Today‚Äôs jump in price has seen chainlink move above a long-term ceiling of $6.50, after trading above this mark for the last two-months.
From the chart, the rise has seen price strength rise to a ceiling of its own at 42.00, however it has so far failed to move beyond this level.
Price strength is now at a reading of 41.20, with a support point at 40.00, in the event momentum begins to shift.
A slight shift has already occurred, with LINK now trading at $6.58, which is marginally below earlier highs.
Register your email here to get weekly price analysis updates sent to your inbox:
Could chainlink move beyond $7.00 in May? Let us know your thoughts in the comments.

entry.title: The 2024 Presidential Election Could Make Or Break Bitcoin In The U.S.
entry.summary: This is an opinion editorial by Robert Hall, a content creator and small business owner. The race for the 2024 U.S. presidential election is starting to kick into gear, featuring some of the same cast of characters from the last few elections. On the Democratic side, you have Joe Biden, Robert F. Kennedy and Marianne Williamson suggesting they will run. Then, Former President Donald Trump, Nikki Haley, Ron DeSantis and Vivek Ramaswamy are on the other side of the aisle. If you have been following the race so far, you might know that Trump seems to be walking away with the nomination before the process even starts next year. If he ends up being the nominee, we will likely get a re-run of 2020, where we have two men over 70 years old who both think that they know what is right for the countr‚Ä¶

entry.title: Bitcoin, Ethereum Technical Analysis: BTC Rebounds From 2-Month Low, as Bulls Enter the Market
entry.summary:
Bitcoin bounced back from a near two-month low on Saturday, as bulls moved in to buy the recent dip in price. Saturday‚Äôs move came as the cryptocurrency rebounded from a recent support point, after yesterday‚Äôs breakout. Ethereum was also higher, climbing above $1,800.
Bitcoin
Bitcoin (BTC) moved away from a recent two-month low on Saturday, as bulls opted to buy the recent dip.
After falling to a low of $25,878.43 on Friday, BTC/USD rose to an intraday high of $26,989.07 earlier in the day.
Today‚Äôs rebound sees bitcoin jump back above a key support point at $26,500, following Friday‚Äôs breakout.
From the chart, it appears that this took place as the 14-day relative strength index (RSI) found a floor of its own at 36.00.
At the time of writing, price strength is tracking at 37.99, with a ceiling at 43.00 a possible target.
Should bulls lead the charge to this point, it is likely that bitcoin will be back above the $27,000 level this weekend.
Ethereum
Ethereum (ETH) was back above a key price level to start the weekend, as it once again rose above the $1,800 mark.
ETH/USD hit a peak of $1,816.06 in today‚Äôs session, less than 24 hours after declining to a low at $1,747.94.
Bulls have seemingly taken yesterday‚Äôs move to a multi-week low as an opportune moment to increase position sizes in ETH.
Like with BTC, this was helped by the fact that RSI found a stable point of support, which in the case of ethereum was at the 41.00 zone.
From the floor, price strength is now tracking close to a ceiling at 45.00, and should this be broken, ETH will possibly move back above a key point at $1,830.
Register your email here to get weekly price analysis updates sent to your inbox:
Could ethereum and bitcoin continue to climb this weekend? Leave your thoughts in the comments below.

entry.summary: A heavyweight in the business world, the organization says the SEC's "regulatory chaos is by design, not happenstance."

entry.title: Your Crypto Mining Chips Are No Good for AI‚ÄîHere‚Äôs Why
entry.summary: Mining and AI have different tastes when it comes to GPUs, and crypto miners can‚Äôt satisfy them both.

entry.title: AI Is Hot‚ÄîBut Meta Is Still ‚ÄòReally Interested in the Metaverse,‚Äô Exec Claims
entry.summary: Meta‚Äôs short-term focus has shifted towards AI, but an exec says that such tools will actually help its metaverse vision come to life.

entry.title: Why Heavy Metal Band Avenged Sevenfold Keeps Betting on NFTs
entry.summary: Avenged Sevenfold frontman M. Shadows appeared on Decrypt‚Äôs gm podcast to discuss why he thinks NFTs give fans a better experience.

entry.title: How Mirandus is Innovating Video Game Audio
entry.summary: Mirandus' Lead Developer and Gala Games Cofounder Michael McCarthy tells Decrypt's Kate Irwin about the game's thoughtful approach to audio design and the technologies being built to support the MMORPG's immersive world.

entry.title: IRS Trains Ukraine Law Enforcement to Track and Trace Russia's Cryptocurrency Moves
entry.summary: "We resist the aggressor state not only on the battlefield, but also on the economic front," said the head of Ukraine's Economic Security Bureau.

entry.title: ‚ÄòWe Screwed Up‚Äô: Coinbase Apologizes for Pepe Comments as #DeleteCoinbase Trends
entry.summary: The move comes after the hashtag trended on Twitter, as PEPE holders bristled over Coinbase's description of Pepe's past alt-right history.

entry.title: Solana Labs Opening 25,000-Square-Foot Office Space in NYC
entry.summary: Despite shuttering stores earlier this year, the company behind the 10th biggest cryptocurrency is opening co-working space.

entry.title: Silvergate Lays Off 230 Workers as Crypto-Friendly Bank Continues Wind Down
entry.summary: The banked shuttered in March after its deposits were rocked in the wake of FTX‚Äôs collapse.

entry.title: Do Gamers Hate NFTs?
entry.summary: Decrypt's Kate Irwin asks the InfiniGods developers Damon Gura and Owen O‚ÄôDonoghue about gamers and NFTs.

entry.title: Breaking Boundaries: YuYu's Personal Journey as a Queer Artist in the NFT World
entry.summary: YuYu‚Äôs first NFT-powered exhibit ‚ÄúGAG‚Äù merges a variety of artforms‚Äîincluding traditional art and photography‚Äîall on the blockchain.

entry.title: Gaming Dominates On-Chain Transactions in April as Arbitrum Users Surge
entry.summary: The meme token craze might be impacting Web3 gaming activity, DappRadar suggests, but Arbitrum users are up and Sui is gaining steam.

entry.title: Bitcoin Miners Earning $40M Daily Revenue as Ordinals Debate Splits Devs
entry.summary: Miners have struggled as of late, but the Ordinals craze is creating a windfall for a fortunate few.

entry.title: Bitcoin and Ethereum Down 3%, Top Altcoins Fall as Market Sees Red
entry.summary: Now that Bitcoin fees have subsided, delayed selling has dragged down BTC, ETH, and altcoin prices a day after the U.S. CPI report.

entry.title: gm: Avenged Sevenfold's M. Shadows on Deathbats, Fandom, and AI
entry.summary: Avenged Sevenfold lead singer Matt Sanders, aka M. Shadows, is rehearsing for the band's upcoming tour. He's also figuring out how to upend what it means to be a music fan. The band launched a Deathbats Club NFT collection in 2021. That is to say: They were early. The lead singer said it was timed to give fans a chance to get comfortable with Web3 technology ahead of the group's 2023 tour, when the NFT holders can use their Deathbats for early access to tickets. M. Shadows also talked to hosts Andrew Hayward and Stephen Graves about AI and bringing Web3 into gaming.

entry.title: Inside Mojo Melee's Lore with Creator Mike Levine and Art Director Eric Campanella
entry.summary: At the Game Developers' Conference, Mojo Melee Creator Mike Levine and Art Director Eric Campanella tell Decrypt's Kate Irwin about their autobattler game and its unique characters, which are also NFTs on Polygon.

entry.title: Why 'Blair Witch' Exec Producer Kevin Foxe Is '1,000% In' on Gaming
entry.summary: "The Blair Witch Project" Executive Producer Kevin Foxe wants to avoid corporate overlords and enlighten fans of the dark "Mandala" graphic novel with a video game adaptation and NFTs across multiple blockchains.

entry.title: Gala Games Co-Founder on the Aesthetic of Mirandus
entry.summary: "When assets are overdone, they just feel a little dirty. It's not pretty to look at," shared Mirandus' Lead Developer and Gala Games co-founder Michael McCarthy in an interview with Decrypt's Kate Irwin.

entry.title: Solana Games GM: Play-to-Earn Games Are DeFi Products, Not Games
entry.summary: Solana Games' General Manager Johnny Lee offers a hot take on the first generation of Web3 gaming with Decrypt's Kate Irwin.

entry.title: Brycent's Advice For Gaming Content Creators
entry.summary: XSET's Brycent shares his advice for Web3 content creators with Decrypt's Kate Irwin, including which social media platform is best for posting content.

entry.title: Behind the Scenes of Jeremy Cowart's 'Auras' NFT Event
entry.summary: A look at the preparation behind "Auras," an event in which photographer Jeremy Cowart produced and starred in 10,000 photo-based NFTs, captured in less than 30 minutes before a live audience. Credit: Brett Carlsen for Decrypt

entry.title: Jeremy Cowart Discusses 'Auras' Event, Live-Shooting 10,000 Photo NFTs
entry.summary: Jeremy Cowart speaks with Decrypt's Sander Lutz in Nashville ahead of the "Auras" event, in which the noted photographer live-shot 10,000 unique photo-based NFTs in less than 30 minutes. The NFTs will be released through OpenSea on May 9. Video credit: Brett Carlsen for Decrypt

entry.title: Azra Games CEO on Putting Fun Before Web3
entry.summary: "The Web3 interfaces cannot be on the foreground of the player's initial experience," says Azra Games CEO Mark Otero.

entry.title: gm: Meet Immunefi's White Hat Whisperer
entry.summary: When Web3 bug bounty platform Immunefi launched two years ago, CEO and founder Mitchell Amador says the bug bounties weren't great and adoption was slow. But the tides started to turn because even if exploiting a smart contract nets a bigger payday than a bounty, it comes with a huge drawback. "There's a ton of risk when you engage in this, you know, wantonly criminal behavior and steal $200 million from someone else," he said. "There's no way someone's not going to come looking."

entry.title: Gala Games Co-Founder on Why Mirandus Will Not Have NPCs
entry.summary: Lead Mirandus Developer and Gala Games Cofounder Michael McCarthy tells Decrypt's Kate Irwin about the Web3 MMORPG Mirandus and what its world will be like.

entry.title: NFC Lisbon Founder John Karp Heralds 'Level 2' Content for 2023 Event
entry.summary: No panels, no problem. This year's NFC Lisbon from June 7 to June 9 boasts a variety of alternative formats, catering to a decentralized (and sometimes pseudonymous) NFT community. The event also plans to take a closer look into one of the faster-growing niches in NFTs: Photography and what founder John Karp calls "level 2" content. Not to be missed, as NFC Lisbon's media partner, Decrypt will be on-site for all three days. Come say hi!

entry.title: How Does Magic Eden Vet Web3 Games?
entry.summary: Magic Eden Chief Gaming Officer Chris Akhavan tells Decrypt's Kate Irwin about how the NFT marketplace vets potential Web3 games for its platform.

entry.title: Interview: Kevin Rose on the 'Weird Dynamic' of Building an NFT Project
entry.summary: Proof co-founder and CEO Kevin Rose chats with Decrypt Culture Editor Andrew Hayward during NFT NYC 2023 to discuss his startup's reaffirmed focus on digital art and collectors, the challenges of building in the NFT market, and what he's learned in the last year since the buzzy Moonbirds drop.

entry.title: How MMORPG Mirandus is Managing its Web3 Elements
entry.summary: Gala Games Cofounder Michael McCarthy says an "unbelievable" amount of Mirandus conversations are about its approach to Web3 and crypto transactions.

entry.title: What Is Azra Games's Creative Process?
entry.summary: Azra Games CEO Mark Otero tells Decrypt's Kate Irwin about Azra's creative process to game development and storytelling.

entry.title: Aurory Is 'Pokemon Meets The Matrix,' Says Executive Producer
entry.summary: The Aurory Web3 game's Executive Producer Jonathan Campeau tells Decrypt's Kate Irwin at the 2023 Game Developer's Conference about the game and what it's like to play.
